description: The distribution of data where each observation can have one of two outcomes, like success/failure, yes/no or head/tails.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: An inferential test used to compare observed frequencies with expected frequencies in categorical conditions
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Data that can take on any values between other existing values.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Data that can only take certain values, such as integers.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A way to describe the shape of data
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Statistics that allow you to make predictions about or comparisons between data (e.g., t-value, F-value, rho)
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A data type representing whole numbers.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: data which comes in the form of a numerical value where the difference between points is standardised and meaningful
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A rating scale with a small number of discrete points in order
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Categorical variables that don't have an inherent order, such as types of animal.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A symmetric distribution of data where values near the centre are most probable.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Discrete variables that have an inherent order, such as number of legs
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: All members of a group that we wish to generalise our findings to. E.g. all students taking Psychology at the University of Glasgow. We draw our testing sample from the population.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A number between 0 and 1 where 0 indicates impossibility of the event and 1 indicates certainty
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: data which comes in the form of a numerical value where the difference between points is standardised and meaningful but has a meaningful zero
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A subset of the population that you wish to make an inference about through your test.
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: Generating data, as opposed to collecting data, from summary parameters such as the mean and standard deviation
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8

description: A distribution where all numbers in the range have an equal probability of being sampled
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 8
